alert.note: Alert for Dale; Geneva; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 1:56AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Dale, Henry, eastern Geneva and Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, northwestern Miller, Clay, Randolph, western Calhoun, northwestern Seminole, Early, Quitman and western Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 400 AM EST/300 AM CST/... At 255 AM EST/155 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Georgetown to 6 miles south of Hartford. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Cottonwood, Fort Gaines, Georgetown, Blakely, Cuthbert, Headland, Dothan, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Ashford, Slocomb, Cowarts, Edison, Arlington, Webb, Shellman and Columbia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EST/500 AM CST/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
